data.title: Love it
data.text: I lived in Thailand for three years so I have some experience when I say this is the best Thai food I have found in Boston. Very nice service. Good wines. And excellent food. We tried the duck dishes and the papaya salad and Tod Mun. All great.

data.title: Decent food and price
data.text: Small place with quick service. Dishes are spicy to the point that they are a little overbearing so ask your server. Nice place for a quick dinner out if you're in the area.

data.title: Consistently Delightful
data.text: Five visits, all excellent, varying dishes.  Quite nice to eat in and quite fast for take out.  Great value.  Why four stars instead of five?  Because that means excellent, delicious, good value to me.  Will I return here often?  Yes.  The crispy chicken pad thai is great, the spicy salads as well and the hospitality is warm.  Since Lam's closed some years ago this is the most interesting and satisfying Thai nearby;  no question.

data.title: Authentic scrumptious Thai food.
data.text: I love this little place. It is tiny and in the winter it was often drafty and cold but I really prefer Thai food straight from the kitchen rather than take out. The atmosphere is cheery and the staff exude warmth and the desire that you enjoy their food. Some of their specialties are not your usual pad Thai. Like Ka Na Moo Krob (Stir fried crispy pork belly with Chinese broccoli, peppers in yellow bean sauce). There are dishes from different parts of Thailand. My favorite is extra spicy green curry with duck. The only problem we have encountered is Inconsistency. Sometimes, especially with take out, the food just isn't as good as usual.

data.title: Best for takeout
data.text: Very good Thai cuisine.  Setting is not what I would choose -- on the small side, and very well lit, not so relaxing for a meal.  But excellent for takeout.

data.title: Excellent Thai Food
data.text: Our neighbor had told us about the excellent Thai food at this small restaurant located in a nondescript strip mall so we decided to try it.  We went there about 6 p.m. on a Sunday and were the only diners in the place, but by the time we left every table (there are only about 10) was taken, nearly all by people whom I believe were Thai.  We had shumai as an appetizer and it was the best we ever had.  The pad thai was excellent and my husband said the chicken yellow curry was very, very good although it seemed to have an excess amount of sauce.  Prices are reasonable and portions more than adequate.  Service was a little scattered since there were only two women working the front of the house and they had to greet and seat people, serve the food, clear the tables and take quite a few calls for carry-out.  However they were very nice.  We definitely plan on returning.

data.title: Tasty Thai
data.text: I was lucky to have lunch here three days in a row while training nearby. I know Thai food well and found their dishes to be made fresh and savory daily. Just the right amount of seasoning and healthy vegetables with sculpted garnish from carrots or other items to delight your eyes as well. Prices are very reasonable and the portions are perfect for me. I have a good appetite and left satisfied every day. Great place to have lunch. The soups were fabulous!

data.title: Excellent Thai in Newton
data.text:
Since moving to Newton, I've been looking for a go-to Thai place and generally have been underwhelmed. Despite its location in a nondescript strip mall, the decor, service and food at Manow Thai are top notch. The vegetables were fresh, the chicken was tasty, and the food was seasoned well.

Great for eating in or take-out.

data.title: A Great Surprise
data.text: Yes, it's located in a strange place inbetween pizza and a liquor store, but inside is lovely.  It's the best Thai food I've had in years, reasonably priced and they are very gracious.  Family owned.  Be sure to go there!

data.title: So glad to have found this!
data.text: We miss another Thai restaurant nearby that closed, but this one is even better. After dining twice, the pad thai is a highlight without a doubt. Same with the coconut-chicken soup as well as the golden pouches.

data.title: Great Authentic Thai Food
data.text: We love the authentic Thai food here. Love the coconut soup, curry puffs, Eggplant basil, plus the Pad Woonsen (glass noodles) are excellent. We get takeout often, and like the decor eating at the restaurant too.

data.title: Nice place  for real  Thai food
data.text: Wow nice real Thai  food  with  real Thai  taste. Some  places  say real Thai  but this  is real Thai food right  from  Thailand.
